columns.name: ec2_instance_id
columns.description: The Amazon EC2 instance ID for the instance. When the AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_ID attribute is specified, then the AWS_INSTANCE_IPV4 attribute contains the primary private IPv4 address.

columns.name: alias_dns_name
columns.description: For an alias record that routes traffic to an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer, the DNS name that's associated with the load balancer.

columns.name: instance_cname
columns.description: A CNAME record, the domain name that Route 53 returns in response to DNS queries (for example, example.com ).

columns.name: init_health_status
columns.description: If the service configuration includes HealthCheckCustomConfig, you can optionally use AWS_INIT_HEALTH_STATUS to specify the initial status of the custom health check, HEALTHY or UNHEALTHY. If you don't specify a value for AWS_INIT_HEALTH_STATUS, the initial status is HEALTHY.

columns.name: instance_ipv4
columns.description: For an A record, the IPv4 address that Route 53 returns in response to DNS queries.

columns.name: instance_ipv6
columns.description: For an AAAA record, the IPv6 address that Route 53 returns in response to DNS queries.

columns.name: instance_port
columns.description: For an SRV record, the value that Route 53 returns for the port. In addition, if the service includes HealthCheckConfig, the port on the endpoint that Route 53 sends requests to.
